resource.chars:
(8) 
<u>Thunder<\u> was more frequent at <u>Lund<\u> than 
<u>Petersburgh<\u> during that time. 

An Abstract of the <u>Meteorological Obser<\u>-
vations of the whole Year 1724 made at 
<u>Lunden<\u> in <u>Sweden<\u> by . . . . . Abridged 
for the use of the R.S. by <u>W. Derham<\u> F.R.S. 
Having taken notice of the Observations 
in 1724 that tally, I proceed to the whole Years 
Observations of <u>Lunden<\u>. 
I begin with the <u>Barometrical Ranges<\u>, 
w<sup>ch<\sup> will be best seen, & compared by these two 
little Tables: the first of w<sup>ch<\sup> is, in part, the 
curious Authors, viz the Mean Heights of the 
[mercury symbol], to w<sup>ch<\sup> I have added the Highest & Lowest 
Ranges in each Month. And because it will take 
up but little room, I have added the Author's 
Mean of his Thermometrical Observations, al-
though I confesse I scarce understand the Divi-
sions of his Thermometer.
